name: Student DOE, a Minor, by M. DOE, her Guardian, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Education, Robert C. Wilburn, Secretary of Education, and Bensalem Township School District
name_abbreviation: Doe v. Commonwealth, State Board of Education

parties: Student DOE, a Minor, by M. DOE, her Guardian, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Education, Robert C. Wilburn, Secretary of Education, and Bensalem Township School District.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 31st day of January, 1986, this Court, sua sponte, quashes the appeal in the above matter. Record costs to be paid by appellant pursuant to Pa.R.A.P. 2741(1).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Doris Applebaum, Cornwells Heights, for appellant.
David M. Donaldson, Deputy Atty. Gen., Philadelphia, for appellee.
James M. McMaster, Newtown, for Bensalem Twp. School Dist.
casebody.head_matter:
503 A.2d 931
Student DOE, a Minor, by M. DOE, her Guardian, Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Education, Robert C. Wilburn, Secretary of Education, and Bensalem Township School District.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 21, 1986.
Decided Jan. 31, 1986.
Doris Applebaum, Cornwells Heights, for appellant.
David M. Donaldson, Deputy Atty. Gen., Philadelphia, for appellee.
James M. McMaster, Newtown, for Bensalem Twp. School Dist.
